string.text: To use the binoculars, select them ($$ACTION_wpn_5$$) and press "fire" to zoom in. The mouse wheel changes magnification. Press F1, F2 and F3 to cycle through camera views.
Binoculars
Crouching
To crouch lower, press ($$ACTION_crouch$$) + (Shift)
To crouch, press ($$ACTION_crouch$$). To crouch even lower, press ($$ACTION_crouch$$) + ($$ACTION_accel$$)
Weapon Holstering
Some Stalkers won't want to talk if I stick my weapon in their face. To hide my weapon, I only need to press that weapon's number key again.
Jumping
Jumping will help me climb on top of low or medium barriers. To jump, press ($$ACTION_jump$$)
Movement types
Overloading

I'm not a mule, so there's a limit to how much I can carry. When the weight of my gear exceeds my limits, I will start losing energy very quickly. I can monitor the current weight of my equipment and the maximum weight I can carry in my inventory.
Radiation

When I wear a radioactive artifact on my belt or enter an area with a high level of background radiation, I'll start losing health and exhibiting signs of radiation poisoning. Effects of radiation can be countered by using antiradiation drugs and vodka.
attitude

By helping other characters I improve their attitude towards me, as well as my general reputation. Better attitude and higher reputation help me when interacting with the people I meet. They will be prone to give me additional information and sell me their items cheaper if I'm in their good books. On the other hand, if I open fire on someone, their attitude towards me will quickly turn negative, as will that of their friends, and they will attack me.

This is a good place to hit the sack. Here I can get a good night's sleep, wait out the night, or simply kill some time. To go to sleep, open the Inventory, set the amount of time I should lie down, and press the Rest button. I'll wake up at the designated time. Sometimes, I'll have dreams...
Sprinting

Sometimes I'll need to run faster than usual. To do this, press ($$ACTION_sprint_toggle$$) while running. While sprinting, I run faster and jump further, but I'll also tire more quickly and will be unable to shoot.

If I don't eat for a while, I becomes hungry. Unless I finds something to eat, I'll start losing health. To prevent this, I must eat regularly. A loaf of bread, tinned food or a piece of sausage will solve the problem easily enough, at least for a while.
Training
Fatigue

Running for a prolonged period of time causes fatigue. If I become exhausted, I won't be able to run and will move at a walking pace. The more I'm carrying, the faster I'll tire. Standing still for a few seconds is enough to recuperate.
Weapon Durability

All weapons have a durability rating. The lower a weapon's durability, the more often it jams. To unjam, reload the weapon by pressing ($$ACTION_wpn_reload$$). The weapon's durability decreases with use. A weapon may become completely useless if struck by bullets.
Open Wounds

When I'm hit, I may start to bleed. Bleeding causes me to constantly lose health. The more serious the bleeding (a green icon means slight bleeding, a red icon indicates a serious hemorrhage), the faster the rate at which I'll lose health. Bleeding will eventually stop with time, but even serious hemorrhages can be stopped immediately using bandages.

In PDA of the deceased Stalker, I found his observations of the anomalies in the tunnels. It turns out that he discovered the pattern of their appearance. I can read this information in my PDA in the "Diary" section.
